---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

For #6718

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [d162730840](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16886/commits/d1627308405c23424cf64a619d539c872f070699)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.SumIteratedDerivative`|948|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ aeval_iterate_derivative_of_ge`
`+ aeval_iterate_derivative_of_lt`
`+ aeval_iterate_derivative_self`
`+ aeval_sumIDeriv`
`+ aeval_sumIDeriv_of_pos`
`+ derivativeFinsupp`
`+ derivativeFinsupp_C`
`+ derivativeFinsupp_X`
`+ derivativeFinsupp_derivative`
`+ derivativeFinsupp_map`
`+ derivativeFinsupp_one`
`+ exists_iterate_derivative_eq_factorial_smul`
`+ iterate_derivative_eq_factorial_smul_sum`
`+ iterate_derivative_eq_sum`
`+ sumIDeriv`
`+ sumIDeriv_C`
`+ sumIDeriv_apply`
`+ sumIDeriv_apply_of_le`
`+ sumIDeriv_apply_of_lt`
`+ sumIDeriv_derivative`
`+ sumIDeriv_eq_self_add`
`+ sumIDeriv_map`
`+ support_derivativeFinsupp_subset_range`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I think that using `ideriv` as abrreviation for "iteratived derivative" is a new convention introduced in this PR, right?
But the rest of mathlib uses `iterate_derivative`. If it is only for these first two lemmas, I think we should just use the "long" version.

The def `sumIderiv` below seems fine to me.
I don't understand the `sl` suffix of this name.
No. Maybe it's just I didn't know how I should name it. It certainly needs a better name.

Should this be a weighted sum instead of a plain sum? A sentence or two explaining why this definition is useful (and/or more useful than the unweighted one) would be great in the module or function docstring.
Only because it isn't needed so far; unless you have use cases to inform the design and what would be useful to prove about it, I think I'd prefer keeping it simple for now
Can you first write the theorem that includes this witness explicitly?

Thinking again; what do you think of first defining
```
def derivativeFinsupp : R[X] [R]   R[X]
```
with `derivFinsupp p i = derivative^[i] p`? this function then falls out by composing with `Finsupp.lsum`.

Some lemmas about the above:
```suggestion

@[simp]
theorem derivativeFinsupp_C (r : R) : derivativeFinsupp (C r : R[X]) = .single 0 (C r) := by
  ext i : 1
  match i with
  | 0 => simp
  | i + 1 => simp

@[simp]
theorem derivativeFinsupp_one : derivativeFinsupp (1 : R[X]) = .single 0 1 := by
  simpa using derivativeFinsupp_C (1 : R)

@[simp]
theorem derivativeFinsupp_X : derivativeFinsupp (X : R[X]) = .single 0 X + .single 1 1 := by
  ext i : 1
  match i with
  | 0 => simp
  | 1 => simp
  | (n + 2) => simp

theorem derivativeFinsupp_map (p : R[X]) (f : R +* S) :
    derivativeFinsupp (p.map f) = (derivativeFinsupp p).mapRange (.map f) (by simp) := by
  ext i : 1
  simp

theorem derivativeFinsupp_derivative (p : R[X]) :
    derivativeFinsupp (derivative p) =
      (derivativeFinsupp p).comapDomain Nat.succ Nat.succ_injective.injOn := by
  ext i : 1
  simp
```
Do you need commutativity here? If not, please reuse the ambient `S`

I'm very curious if there's some way to make this morphism multiplicative by choosing the codomain as some variant of `AddMonoidAlgebra` instead of just a `Finsupp`; but that's definitely not in scope for this PR!
Could you add a short summary of the main definition(s) and theorem(s), and what these are useful for?

> and what these are useful for?

This would be good to have in the module doc, before the list of definitions.

Please also put it in the PR description.
This might make sense closer to `derivative`, rather than in this file.

pullRequest.title: feat: sum of iterated derivatives
